fields.description:

Id: cloudwatch-put-metric-000791316698-3feda7d31b5d068d-ELBAddRemTest,RunId: 625d6be6-d601-4ef8-a97a-33c6c0a06759}

Id: update-loadbalancer-000791316698-3feda7d31b5d068d-ELBAddRemTest,RunId: 6afb22c2-5e22-4b7f-86cb-19a7c7c10705}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: id=DecisionId [type=ACTIVITY, id=4], transitions=[CREATED, handleDecisionTaskStartedEvent, DECISION_SENT, handleInitiatedEvent, INITIATED, handleInitiationFailedEven
t]
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.worker.DecisionStateMachineBase.failStateTransition(DecisionStateMachineBase.java:193)

        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

The swf failures are:

{code}
{
    "eventTimestamp" : 1480664296642,
    "eventType" : "ScheduleActivityTaskFailed",
    "eventId" : 30,
    "scheduleActivityTaskFailedEventAttributes" : {
      "activityType" : {
        "name" : "LoadBalancingVmActivities.getInstanceStatus",
        "version" : "1.0"
      },
      "activityId" : "6",
      "cause" : "ACTIVITY_TYPE_DOES_NOT_EXIST",
      "decisionTaskCompletedEventId" : 27
    }
}

{
    "eventTimestamp" : 1480664296639,
    "eventType" : "ScheduleActivityTaskFailed",
    "eventId" : 34,
    "scheduleActivityTaskFailedEventAttributes" : {
      "activityType" : {
        "name" : "LoadBalancingVmActivities.getCloudWatchMetrics",
        "version" : "1.0"
      },
      "activityId" : "8",
      "cause" : "ACTIVITY_TYPE_DOES_NOT_EXIST",
      "decisionTaskCompletedEventId" : 30
    }
}
  
  
{
    "eventTimestamp" : 1480664307169,
    "eventType" : "ScheduleActivityTaskFailed",
    "eventId" : 19,
    "scheduleActivityTaskFailedEventAttributes" : {
      "activityType" : {
        "name" : "LoadBalancingVmActivities.setLoadBalancer",
        "version" : "1.0"
      },
      "activityId" : "4",
      "cause" : "ACTIVITY_TYPE_DOES_NOT_EXIST",
      "decisionTaskCompletedEventId" : 16
    }
}
{code}

So activities in LoadBalancingVmActivities are not found at when workflows are running.

This does not appear to cause any functionality issues.
fields.summary: ELB swf workflows fail due to activity not found errors

comments.body: This should be a timing issue where scheduling happens before a VM starts and register activity types. We should not log the errors.

Default task list will be fixed, but the activity-not-found errors is due to the way flow-framework works and would be tricky to fix (perhaps not worth to fix). The logs would be written when the first ELB of a Cloud has started and until the VM (activity worker) of the loadbalancer starts and register the activity type. The service can't easily coordinate if/when VM worker register the type.

Perhaps the vm activities could be registered along with the others rather than by a vm? else it may be possible to catch the activity failures in the workflows. If it is not possible to avoid or handle the error then we could modify logging, similar to the fix for EUCA-12989 (for activity failures)
Let's make this a logging change.
Fix for emptying default task list is in maint-4.4.
Logging configuration is updated so these expected failures are not logged.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25808.161.20170217git82fb574.el7}}

*Steps*

# Deploy Eucalyptus 4.4 cloud - [hspencer-400-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/400/]
# Create non-eucalyptus account (for example {{development-operations}}) via {{euare-accountcreate}}
# Bundle, upload and register Ubuntu Xenial HVM EMI:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-63ef779d --region devops-admin@
IMAGE	emi-63ef779d	ubuntu-xenial-x86_64-hvm-20170203/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000727120439	available	public	x86_64	machine			instance-store	hvm
{code}
# Using linked {{cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-vpc-template.json}} template, deploy the stack:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-create-stack ELBASGMultiAZStackV2 --template-file cfn-elb-multiaz-accesslog-cloudwatch-vpc-template.json --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --parameter ImageId=emi-63ef779d --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --parameter MinSize=6 --parameter MaxSize=12 --region devops-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::000727120439:stack/ELBASGMultiAZStackV2/030c1353-0e62-44a2-997d-bb3c685d46eb
[root@h-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@
STACK	ELBASGMultiAZStackV2	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to deploy a 3 availability zone ELB, Nginx deployment on Eucalyptus VPC cloud	2017-03-01T23:10:44.579Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-63ef779d
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	MinSize		6
PARAMETER	MaxSize		12
OUTPUT	AccessLogBucket	elbasgmultiazstackv2-s3loggingbucket-shwe4tnz1022j
OUTPUT	ELBURL	http://ELBASGMul-NginxELB-K67GNSYR6I4JT-000727120439.lb.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}
# Using the AWS CLI, as the admin user of the {{(eucalyptus)loadbalancing}} account, list the closed workflows of the ELB stack deployed (output attached).  Confirm that there are no errors:
{code}
[root@h-04 ~]# aws --endpoint-url http://simpleworkflow.e-32.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ swf list-closed-workflow-executions --domain LoadbalancingDomain --tag-filter tag=loadbalancer:ELBASGMul-NginxELB-K67GNSYR6I4JT --profile elb-admin > swf-workflow-euca12992-output.txt
[root@h-04 ~]# grep -i FAIL swf-workflow-euca12992-output.txt
[root@h-04 ~]#
{code}
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
